name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Carlsbad-North San Diego County

reviews.text: This was our 2nd time staying at this hotel. Like many people say, the walls are thin. If you are a light sleeper, the noise from your neighbors might bother you.
reviews.title: Nice as usual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't hear any airplanes taking off or landing.. unless we just didn't notice... ( we didn't hear it the last time we stayed...)
reviews.title: Outstanding value and best customer service
I was extremely impressed.
reviews.text: Breakfast--- considering that's free, can't complain. Some days it can be very crowded, but luckily it wasn't when we were there. The staff made sure to restock the food and drinks, and kept the area clean. There were 3 different kinds of cereal. They had waffle makers, pastries, toasts, bagles, muffins, fruits, eggs, some days there were sausage patties, biscuits w/ gravy and hash brown..... Light snack at night was just okay... but I think we rather pay to eat out.... Salad was better than the meal..
Beds were comfortable. Room was pretty clean.
reviews.title: Family friendly

reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.
reviews.title: Perfect for families

reviews.text: I think as a parent this place is affordable, clean, is a full suite and very clean. But downside is we had a poolside room and there is little sound insulation with other rooms. Most people seem to be families with young kids off to legoland so this makes it noisy to be honest and breakfast time is chaotic. If youre going to be going to legoland this is a good choice but if youre not a parent with kids, i would steer clear. Oh also and the front desk staff is kind of undertrained. I asked for eating and shopping options and they suggested a vons/albertsons.
reviews.title: Nice and new but be forewarned, is loud.

reviews.text: Homewood suites is one of our favorite hotel since it's totally kids friends as we have a 3 and 5 year old boy. However, during this stay, we got room 359 (room with 2 queen beds) and the room reaked of glue. We couldn't stay in the room for more than 5 mins as we got terrible headaches. We asked to be switched to another equivalent room but night manager refused to switch us. Then I asked to be switched to two rooms and again we were refused. I don't know what the big deal was since the entire hotel was quite empty. Do not take room 359 or rooms right underneath on 2nd and 1st floor as I found out later it has same problem.
reviews.title: Beware room 359

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the other reviewers: Hassle Free and NO rude service!! They maintain a very positive, yet down to earth attitude. Professional all the way. Next time we'll bring my daughter and son in law to enjoy the hotel in tandem with all of the fun things to do around Carlsbad. Hats off to Homewood Suites!! Thank you!! Amy Nymark
reviews.title: When can we go back????

reviews.text: My children and I just recently stayed here and the room was great, the staff went out of their way to help me and the price wasn't too bad either. I did not meet one rude staff member and they had coffee available all night!!! We planned to go to legoland and the day we got there it started raining. The next day it was raining. The Person at the desk took the time to tell me about all the different places we could go and even looked up the weather report to try and let me know when it should stop raining! With 4 small kids, it is really hard to keep things in line and when things like the weather get in the way, any help I can get is wonderful and they went above and beyond! I also had an emergancy with my 1year old who can not sleep without her blanky. Which had gotten dirty. My daughter was already asleep and we thought we were in the clear. Not the case. It was after midnight and the sign says no washes after midnight. I went to the front desk and they were so nice! They said no problem and saved my life that night!!(parents will understand this more) Will for sure visit this wonderful hotel again! Thank you to all of the staff that went out of their way to help me and my family! :)
reviews.title: Wonderful all the way around!

reviews.text: My kids and I visited the hotel at the beginning of December. We were able to get in quickly, everything was clean, and the staff was helpful after an absolutely grueling day. What more can a frazzled mother ask for? It was completely hassle free. I would stay again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Great for a Family

reviews.text: We stayed for 5 days at the Carlsbad Homewood Suites. The free breakfasts and managers reception is a great perk, and helps keep the cost of travel down as it relates to food and drink. Having a mini kitchen is also very practical - we used it every day insome fashion. The room was clean and in great condition. The hotel is 5 miles from the ocean, so be aware you will do a lot of driving on Palomar Airport Road if you want to go to the beach every day.
reviews.title: Comfortable place, with good amenities

reviews.text: The only criticisms are minor, but slightly annoying. Our room, unlike the others, never received a paper at our door. We had to go downstairs every day and get it, or 'borrow' one from another room door. On day 3, when the bathroom was cleaned, the rubber mat for the shower was removed from the room, and never returned. Also, the toilet paper holder disappeared for a day. Weird. Finally, the towels at the pool and whirlpool are very tiny and thin, and barely serve any purpose. Otherwise, it is a good choice, especially for those with families or on a limited budget.
reviews.title: Great value at a great hotel. Good if you have kids.

reviews.text: My husband, 4-year old, 2-year old, and I stayed at the Homewood Suites in Carlsbad, California from January 1-2, 2010.
reviews.title: Please Do Not Buy This Hotel from Expedia

reviews.text: The hotel only has suites. Each suite has a kitchenette, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. The suite was clean. The kitchenette had a full size refrigerator and microwave. It had dishes and utensils. There was complimentary popcorn, and the popcorn setting on the microwave was perfectly timed. The kitchen also had a sponge and dish soap and paper towels. Check-in was easy and quick. The hotel is a 5-minute drive to Legoland, which was the reason for our trip. Tip: if you're going to Legoland, book the hotel through the Legoland website; it's $30 cheaper than booking online through the hotel website. The suite was big enough to accommodate our family, and there's a sofa bed, if needed. There was a little shop where you can buy frozen pizza, ice cream, or chips. The free breakfast buffet was great. It's in the hotel lobby, and there's hot foods (eggs, pancakes, etc.) as well as different breads and muffins. There was a toaster that toast bread as well as bagels. They had oatmeal, cereal, juices, and coffee. They even have a belgian waffle maker. They had express check out, where they slip your bill under the door in the morning. If there's no issue, you can just call to check out and be on your way. For the price, this hotel had a lot. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: The Best Homewood at which I Have Stayed
It doesn't get any better
reviews.text: The Hotel is New and Clean. The service from the staff is ok. We bought a 2 Queen bed suite because we have 2 young children thru Expedia. When we arrive, we get a disable room with 1 king bed. The room is in ground floor, close to the swimming pool, the pool open until 10PM, and if you have small children and tried to sleep early, good luck, because you can hear people talking and playing in from the pool.

We stayed here for 4 days while visiting San Diego. This hotel is about 15 minutes from San Diego and 5 minutes from Legoland and the ocean, which was great. The room is a nice suite, with a small kitchen which is great for families. The hot breakfast usually wasn't hot and be sure to be there before it closes, because they literally start packing EVERYTHING up, including cereal, bread, etc. I also wish they would have had a small restaurant or bar.
reviews.title: Okay hotel, but in a great location

reviews.text: separate bedroom and pull-out couch in living area works well for a family. Breakfasts are good and complimentary reception with food during the week.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: We traveled to Homewood Carlsbad to take the family to Legoland for a second year. Let me say that this hotel is one of the cleanest, friendliest hotel we have ever stayed in! They even went out of their way to help us with a problem we had with one of our children, something they did not have to do.
reviews.title: Once again, Homewood Carlsbad came through with flying colors!!

reviews.text: The food was great and they barbecued hamburgers, etc on the outside grill while the kids swam and we had a cocktail on the patio. The general manager came by to make sure our stay was a happy one and chatted a little.
reviews.title: Second stay was as fabulous as the first!!

reviews.text: This is our family"s "home away from home". I highly recommend!
reviews.title: Great hotel staff and service

description: A new 145 all-suite extended stay Hilton hotel in Carlsbad, California where life and work are balanced with the comfort, flexibility and affordability you want. Homewood Suites Carlsbad is centrally located near the extensive Carlsbad business parks and the city's landmark attractions, including LEGOLAND, McClellan-Palomar Airport (CLD), Camp Pendleton, Carlsbad Premium Outlets, Carlsbad Flower Fields and amazing beaches. With easy access to the freeway, the Homewood Suites Carlsbad hotel is just a few miles from other famous San Diego destinations such as the Wild Animal Park, SeaWorld, Del Mar Racetrack and fabulous golf courses. The hotel is only 45 minutes from Orange County, making it an ideal home base for a Southern California vacation.
